props.name: length
props.description: Gets or sets the length of the array. This is a number one higher than the highest index in the array.

methods.name: [iterator]
methods.description: Iterator

methods.name: [unscopables]
methods.description:
Returns an object whose properties have the value 'true'
when they will be absent when used in a 'with' statement.

methods.name: add
methods.description: Alias for `CommandCooldownManager#push()`

params.name: options
params.description: Cooled-down user data

methods.name: at
methods.description:
Takes an integer value and returns the item at that index,
allowing for positive and negative integers.
Negative integers count back from the last item in the array.

methods.name: clean
methods.description: Purge non cooled-down users from this array

params.name: options
params.description: Clean cooldown options

methods.name: concat
methods.description:
Combines two or more arrays.
This method returns a new array without modifying any existing arrays.

params.name: items
params.description: Additional arrays and/or items to add to the end of the array.

methods.name: copyWithin
methods.description:
Returns the this object after copying a section of the array identified by start and end
to the same array starting at position target

params.name: target
params.description:
If target is negative, it is treated as length+target where length is the
length of the array.

params.name: start
params.description:
If start is negative, it is treated as length+start. If end is negative, it
is treated as length+end.

params.name: end
params.description: If not specified, length of the this object is used as its default value.

methods.name: entries
methods.description: Returns an iterable of key, value pairs for every entry in the array

methods.name: every
methods.description: Determines whether all the members of an array satisfy the specified test.

params.name: predicate
params.description:
A function that accepts up to three arguments. The every method calls
the predicate function for each element in the array until the predicate returns a value
which is coercible to the Boolean value false, or until the end of the array.

params.name: thisArg
params.description:
An object to which the this keyword can refer in the predicate function.
If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

methods.name: fill
methods.description: Changes all array elements from `start` to `end` index to a static `value` and returns the modified array

params.name: value
params.description: value to fill array section with

params.name: start
params.description:
index to start filling the array at. If start is negative, it is treated as
length+start where length is the length of the array.

params.name: end
params.description:
index to stop filling the array at. If end is negative, it is treated as
length+end.

methods.name: filter
methods.description: Returns the elements of an array that meet the condition specified in a callback function.

params.name: predicate
params.description: A function that accepts up to three arguments. The filter method calls the predicate function one time for each element in the array.

params.name: thisArg
params.description: An object to which the this keyword can refer in the predicate function. If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

methods.name: find
methods.description:
Returns the value of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and undefined
otherwise.

params.name: predicate
params.description:
find calls predicate once for each element of the array, in ascending
order, until it finds one where predicate returns true. If such an element is found, find
immediately returns that element value. Otherwise, find returns undefined.

params.name: thisArg
params.description:
If provided, it will be used as the this value for each invocation of
predicate. If it is not provided, undefined is used instead.

methods.name: findIndex
methods.description:
Returns the index of the first element in the array where predicate is true, and -1
otherwise.

params.name: predicate
params.description:
find calls predicate once for each element of the array, in ascending
order, until it finds one where predicate returns true. If such an element is found,
findIndex immediately returns that element index. Otherwise, findIndex returns -1.

params.name: thisArg
params.description:
If provided, it will be used as the this value for each invocation of
predicate. If it is not provided, undefined is used instead.

methods.name: flat
methods.description:
Returns a new array with all sub-array elements concatenated into it recursively up to the
specified depth.

params.name: depth
params.description: The maximum recursion depth

methods.name: flatMap
methods.description:
Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array. Then, flattens the result into
a new array.
This is identical to a map followed by flat with depth 1.

params.name: callback
params.description:
A function that accepts up to three arguments. The flatMap method calls the
callback function one time for each element in the array.

params.name: thisArg
params.description:
An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callback function. If
thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

methods.name: forEach
methods.description: Performs the specified action for each element in an array.

params.name: callbackfn
params.description: A function that accepts up to three arguments. forEach calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

params.name: thisArg
params.description: An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callbackfn function. If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

methods.name: get
methods.description: Get someone's cooldown data

params.name: options
params.description: Get cooldown data options

methods.name: includes
methods.description: Determines whether an array includes a certain element, returning true or false as appropriate.

params.name: searchElement
params.description: The element to search for.

params.name: fromIndex
params.description: The position in this array at which to begin searching for searchElement.

methods.name: indexOf
methods.description: Returns the index of the first occurrence of a value in an array, or -1 if it is not present.

params.name: searchElement
params.description: The value to locate in the array.

params.name: fromIndex
params.description: The array index at which to begin the search. If fromIndex is omitted, the search starts at index 0.

methods.name: isCooledDown
methods.description: Check if the given user is cooled-down

params.name: options
params.description: Options to identify if user is on cooldown

methods.name: join
methods.description: Adds all the elements of an array into a string, separated by the specified separator string.

params.name: separator
params.description: A string used to separate one element of the array from the next in the resulting string. If omitted, the array elements are separated with a comma.

methods.name: keys
methods.description: Returns an iterable of keys in the array

methods.name: lastIndexOf
methods.description: Returns the index of the last occurrence of a specified value in an array, or -1 if it is not present.

params.name: searchElement
params.description: The value to locate in the array.

params.name: fromIndex
params.description: The array index at which to begin searching backward. If fromIndex is omitted, the search starts at the last index in the array.

methods.name: map
methods.description: Calls a defined callback function on each element of an array, and returns an array that contains the results.

params.name: callbackfn
params.description: A function that accepts up to three arguments. The map method calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

params.name: thisArg
params.description: An object to which the this keyword can refer in the callbackfn function. If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

methods.name: pop
methods.description:
Removes the last element from an array and returns it.
If the array is empty, undefined is returned and the array is not modified.

methods.name: push
methods.description: Appends new elements to the end of an array, and returns the new length of the array.

params.name: items
params.description: New elements to add to the array.

methods.name: reduce
methods.description: Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

params.name: callbackfn
params.description: A function that accepts up to four arguments. The reduce method calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

methods.name: reduceRight
methods.description: Calls the specified callback function for all the elements in an array, in descending order. The return value of the callback function is the accumulated result, and is provided as an argument in the next call to the callback function.

params.name: callbackfn
params.description: A function that accepts up to four arguments. The reduceRight method calls the callbackfn function one time for each element in the array.

methods.name: remove
methods.description: Remove cooldown from specific user, channel or guild

params.name: options
params.description: Remove cooldown data options

params.name: limit
params.description: Remove cooldown data limit

methods.name: reverse
methods.description:
Reverses the elements in an array in place.
This method mutates the array and returns a reference to the same array.

methods.name: shift
methods.description:
Removes the first element from an array and returns it.
If the array is empty, undefined is returned and the array is not modified.

methods.name: slice
methods.description:
Returns a copy of a section of an array.
For both start and end, a negative index can be used to indicate an offset from the end of the array.
For example, -2 refers to the second to last element of the array.

params.name: start
params.description:
The beginning index of the specified portion of the array.
If start is undefined, then the slice begins at index 0.

params.name: end
params.description:
The end index of the specified portion of the array. This is exclusive of the element at the index 'end'.
If end is undefined, then the slice extends to the end of the array.

methods.name: some
methods.description: Determines whether the specified callback function returns true for any element of an array.

params.name: predicate
params.description:
A function that accepts up to three arguments. The some method calls
the predicate function for each element in the array until the predicate returns a value
which is coercible to the Boolean value true, or until the end of the array.

params.name: thisArg
params.description:
An object to which the this keyword can refer in the predicate function.
If thisArg is omitted, undefined is used as the this value.

methods.name: sort
methods.description:
Sorts an array in place.
This method mutates the array and returns a reference to the same array.

params.name: compareFn
params.description:
Function used to determine the order of the elements. It is expected to return
a negative value if the first argument is less than the second argument, zero if they're equal, and a positive
value otherwise. If omitted, the elements are sorted in ascending, ASCII character order.
```ts
[11,2,22,1].sort((a, b) => a - b)
```

methods.name: splice
methods.description: Removes elements from an array and, if necessary, inserts new elements in their place, returning the deleted elements.

params.name: start
params.description: The zero-based location in the array from which to start removing elements.

params.name: deleteCount
params.description: The number of elements to remove.

returns.description: An array containing the elements that were deleted.

methods.returnsDescription: An array containing the elements that were deleted.

methods.name: toLocaleString
methods.description: Returns a string representation of an array. The elements are converted to string using their toLocaleString methods.

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a string representation of an array.

methods.name: unshift
methods.description: Inserts new elements at the start of an array, and returns the new length of the array.

params.name: items
params.description: Elements to insert at the start of the array.

methods.name: values
methods.description: Returns an iterable of values in the array

methods.name: checkOptions
methods.description: Check if the options are valid

params.name: options
params.description: Options to validated

params.name: data
params.description: Cooled-down user data

methods.name: from
methods.description: Creates an array from an array-like object.

params.name: arrayLike
params.description: An array-like object to convert to an array.

methods.name: of
methods.description: Returns a new array from a set of elements.

params.name: items
params.description: A set of elements to include in the new array object.

methods.name: addAliases
methods.description: Add aliases to the command

params.name: aliases
params.description: Command aliases

methods.name: addOption
methods.description: Add option to the command

params.name: option
params.description: Message option builder

methods.name: setAllowExecuteByBots
methods.description: Allow command to be executed by bots

params.name: allowExecuteByBots
params.description: `true` if the command can be executed by bots

methods.name: setAllowExecuteInDM
methods.description: Set if command can be executed in dms

params.name: allowExecuteInDM
params.description: `true` if the command can execute in DMs

methods.name: setCooldown
methods.description:
Sets the execute cooldown for this command.
- `0` means no cooldown

params.name: cooldown
params.description: Command cooldown in milliseconds

methods.name: setDescription
methods.description: Sets the command description

params.name: description
params.description: Command description

methods.name: setExecute
methods.description: Function when the command is executed

params.name: execute
params.description: Function to execute when the command is called

methods.name: setHalt
methods.description: Function when the command is interupted

params.name: halt
params.description: Function to execute when command is halted

methods.name: setMetadata
methods.description: Set a command metadata

params.name: metadata
params.description: Command metadata

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Sets the command name

params.name: name
params.description: Command name

methods.name: setRequiredBotPermissions
methods.description: Set required bot permissions to execute the command

params.name: permissions
params.description: Bot's required permissions

methods.name: setRequiredMemberPermissions
methods.description: Set required permissions to execute the command

params.name: permissions
params.description: User's return permissions

methods.name: setValidateOptions
methods.description: Validate options before executing

params.name: validateOptions
params.description: `true` if the command options needs to be validated before executing

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Returns JSON object of this builder

methods.name: isMessageCommandBuilder
methods.description: Is a message command builder

methods.name: isMessageCommandExecuteData
methods.description: Is a message command execute data

methods.name: setDescription
methods.description: Set command option description

params.name: description
params.description: Option description

methods.name: setName
methods.description: Set command option name

params.name: name
params.description: Option name

methods.name: setRequired
methods.description: Set if this option is required

params.name: required
params.description: `true` if this option is required

methods.name: setValidator
methods.description: Set your custom function to validate given value for this option

params.name: validator
params.description: Custom function to validate value given for this option

props.name: captureRejections
props.description: Sets or gets the default captureRejection value for all emitters.

props.name: errorMonitor
props.description:
This symbol shall be used to install a listener for only monitoring `'error'`
events. Listeners installed using this symbol are called before the regular
`'error'` listeners are called.

Installing a listener using this symbol does not change the behavior once an
`'error'` event is emitted, therefore the process will still crash if no
regular `'error'` listener is installed.

methods.name: rawListeners
removeListener
setMaxListeners
methods.description:
By default `EventEmitter`s will print a warning if more than `10` listeners are
added for a particular event. This is a useful default that helps finding
memory leaks. The `emitter.setMaxListeners()` method allows the limit to be
modified for this specific `EventEmitter` instance. The value can be set to`Infinity` (or `0`) to indicate an unlimited number of listeners.

Returns a reference to the `EventEmitter`, so that calls can be chained.

welcome.name: Welcome
welcome.content:
A simple Dicord.js handler that just works.

***

# Features * [CLI based handler](#command-line) * [Message command builder](#messagecommandbuilder-example) * [Built-in message command validation](#built-in-message-command-validation) * Automatically register application commands * [Built-in command cooldowns](#command-cooldowns) * [Highly configurable](#config) ## Installation To install the bot, run the following command in your terminal: ```bash npm i reciple ``` You can initialize the bot to the current directory with the following command in your terminal: ```bash npx reciple ``` It will ask you to continue if the directory is not empty. Type `y` to continue. After the bot has been initialized, it will ask you for your bot token. > You can change the token anytime you want ## Config You can configure the bot in `reciple.yml` located in the bot's root directory. ### Token You can directly change the token in `reciple.yml`. ```yml token: "YOUR_TOKEN_HERE" ``` Using environment variables is also supported. ```yml token: "env:TOKEN_VARIABLE" ``` You can override the given token using your terminal ```bash npx reciple --token "YOUR_TOKEN_HERE" ``` Use env variable ```bash npx reciple --token "env:TOKEN_VARIABLE" ``` ## Starting the bot To start the bot, run the following command: ```bash npx reciple ``` ## Command line **Usage:** `reciple [options] [current-working-directory]` **Arguments:** * `current-working-directory` Change the current working directory **Options:** * `-v, --version` output the version number * `-t, --token ` Replace used bot token * `-c, --config ` Change path to config file * `-D, --debugmode` Enable debug mode * `-y, --yes` Automatically agree to Reciple confirmation prompts * `-v, --version` Display version * `-h, --help` display help for command ## MessageCommandBuilder Example * Read docs for [`MessageCommandBuilder`](https://reciple.js.org/classes/MessageCommandBuilder.html) ```js new MessageCommandBuilder() .setName("command") .setDescription("Your lil tiny description") .addAliases('cmd', 'cmd1') .setExecute(command => command.message.reply("Hello!")) ``` ## Built-in message command validation * Read docs for [`MessageCommandBuilder#setValidateOptions()`](https://reciple.js.org/classes/MessageCommandBuilder.html#setValidateOptions) * Read docs for [`MessageCommandOptionBuilder`](https://reciple.js.org/classes/MessageCommandOptionBuilder.html) * Read docs for [`MessageCommandOptionManager`](https://reciple.js.org/classes/MessageCommandOptionManager.html) ```js new MessageCommandBuilder() .setName("command") .setDescription("Your lil tiny description") .addAliases('cmd', 'cmd1') .setValidateOptions(true) // Validate options .addOption(option => option .setName("quantity") .setDescription("Must be a number") .setRequired(true) // A required option .setValidator(val => !isNaN(Number(val))) // Validate value ) .setExecute(async command => { const quantity = Number(command.options.getValue('quantity', true)); await command.message.reply("Quantity: " + quantity); }) ``` ## Command Cooldowns * Read docs for [`SlashCommandBuilder#setCooldown()`](https://reciple.js.org/classes/SlashCommandBuilder.html#setCooldown) * Read docs for [`MessageCommandBuilder#setCooldown()`](https://reciple.js.org/classes/MessageCommandBuilder.html#setCooldown) * Read docs for [`CommandHaltReason`](https://reciple.js.org/enums/CommandHaltReason.html) * Read docs for [`CommandCooldownData`](https://reciple.js.org/interfaces/CommandCooldownData.html) ```js // Slash command new SlashCommandBuilder() .setName("command") .setDescription("Your lil tiny description") .setCooldown(1000 * 60) // Cooldown in milliseconds .setExecute(command => command.interaction.reply('hi')) .setHalt(async halt => { // Handle command on cooldown if (halt.reason == CommandHaltReason.Cooldown) { await halt.executeData.interaction.reply((halt.expireTime - Date.now()) / 1000 + " seconds cooldown"); return true; } }) // Message command new MessageCommandBuilder() .setName("command") .setDescription("Your lil tiny description") .setCooldown(1000 * 60) // Cooldown in milliseconds .setExecute(command => command.message.reply('hi')) .setHalt(async halt => { // Handle command on cooldown if (halt.reason == CommandHaltReason.Cooldown) { await halt.executeData.message.reply((halt.expireTime - Date.now()) / 1000 + " seconds cooldown"); return true; } }) ``` *** > ## Fun Fact > The name reciple is from a minecraft bug. The bug was a misspelling of the word `recipe`. [View Mojang Bug Report](https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MC-225837) *** [#letTheEarthBreathe](https://rebellion.global/)
